title: PHPpopen()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPpopen()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Open a pipe to the program specified in the
command
parameter:
<?php
$file = popen("/bin/ls","r");
//some code to be executed
pclose($file);
?>
Definition and Usage
The popen() function opens a pipe to the program specified in the command parameter.
Syntax
popen(
command
,
mode
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
command
Required. Specifies the command to execute
mode
Required. Specifies the connection mode. Can be "r" (Read only) or "w" (Write only - opens and clears existing file or creates a new file)
Technical Details
Return Value:
FALSE on failure
PHP Version:
4.0+

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPpopen()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPpopen()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPpopen()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
